page.title: 10HISTORICAL BUILDINGS, ANLABY
page.content: There are three buildings of particular historical interest in Anlaby. Each of the houses was orginally a private residence but today, only the {OLD HALL}remains so. The Hall is set in a quarter-acre of gardens and is valued at Â£100,000. There are 8 upstairs rooms and 10 downstairs. The other two buildings of interest are {ANLABY HOUSE} and { {TRANBY CROFT.}Anlaby House is now the home of Beverley Council's finance department. From here the rates and salaries are administered. In the grounds, but not within the house itself, are situated the offices of the Water Authority and other departments. Tranby Croft today is a fee-paying school belonging to the Church Schools Company Ltd. Known as the Hull High School for Girls, it has 500 pupils between 4 and 18 years old.
